intro: Bulbostylis spadicea, commonly known as the spike-rush, is a member of the Cyperaceae family, characterized by its grass-like appearance and cylindrical inflorescence. It is a small, herbaceous plant that typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, thriving in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense spikes. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense colonies in suitable environments. Bulbostylis spadicea plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
